issues.description: The `ArrayHelpers` class in the template repository defines a method named `appendElement`, but the `Stock` class (which is also part of the template) attempts to call a method named `addElementToArray` from `ArrayHelpers`. This discrepancy means the provided template code for `Stock.java` will not compile without modification, as the method `addElementToArray` does not exist in the template's `ArrayHelpers.java`. This forces students to fix an inconsistency in the provided starter code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `appendElement` method to `addElementToArray` in `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/ArrayHelpers.java` to match the method call in `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Stock.java`.

issues.description: The `ArrayHelpers` class in the template repository declares a method named `appendElement`, but the `Stock` class in the same template repository (and the `SealSaloon` class in the solution repository) attempts to call a method named `addElementToArray` on `ArrayHelpers` for the same conceptual operation of adding an element to an array. This mismatch will lead to compilation errors for students using the template as-is, as `addElementToArray` does not exist in the template's `ArrayHelpers`.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `appendElement` method to `addElementToArray` in `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/ArrayHelpers.java` to align with its usage in `Stock.java` and the solution's implementation.
